edu.stmc

Class SPRT.Binary

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stmc.SPRT.Binary
  • Enclosing class:
    SPRT

    public static final class SPRT.Binary
extends java.lang.Object
    SPRT for binary simple hypothesis testing.
    • Binary means if the algorithm terminates, there are two possibilities for its answer.
    • Simple means null and alternative hypotheses must be in the form of H0: p=p0 and H1: p=p1, respectively (for some values of 0<p0<p1<1). Note that H0: p<p0 is not a simple hypothesis.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Binary

        public Binary(double threshold,
              double alpha,
              double beta,
              double delta)
        Construct an instance of the binary version of SPRT
        Parameters:
        threshold - Input threshold
        alpha - Type I error probability (also known as false positive probability) is the probability of incorrectly rejecting the null hypothesis.
        beta - Type II error probability (also known as false negative probability) is the probability of incorrectly not rejecting the null hypothesis.
        delta - Half of the size of indifference region.
        Requires:
        0 < lb < threshold < ub < ub < 1, 0 < alpha < 0.5, 0 < beta < 0.5

    • Method Detail

      • status

        public GTResult.Binary status()
        Returns:
        GTResult.Binary.YES, GTResult.Binary.NO, or GTResult.Binary.UNDECIDED.
        • GTResult.Binary.YES means that the test rejected the null hypothesis (the actual probability is not smaller than the threshold in H0).
        • GTResult.Binary.NO means that the test did not reject the null hypothesis.
        • GTResult.Binary.UNDECIDED means that the test is not done yet.
        Ensures:
        Let p be the actual probability. There are two two probabilistic guarantees:
        • If p <= threshold - delta then the probability of returning GTResult.Binary.YES is at most alpha.
        • If p >= threshold + delta then the probability of returning GTResult.Binary.NO is at most beta.

      • check

        public GTResult.Binary check(boolean passed)
        Update the test by adding an observation
        Parameters:
        passed - Whether or not the sample satisfied the test or not.
        Returns:
        status()

      • check

        public GTResult.Binary check(int passed,
                             int failed)
        Update the test by adding the input number of observations
        Parameters:
        passed - Number of samples that are passed
        failed - Number of samples that are failed
        Returns:
        status()
        Requires:
        passed >= 0, failed >= 0
